abstract: The consumer-goods giant Procter & Gamble, long associated with women’s products, is pitching to men with new ads for its Art of Shaving brand.
snippet: The consumer-goods giant Procter & Gamble, long associated with women’s products, is pitching to men with new ads for its Art of Shaving brand.
lead_paragraph: “REPEAT after us,” begins a new print ad by the Art of Shaving, an upscale brand of products that includes shaving cream for $22 and shaving brushes for as much as $600. “I will not let my son shave with a plastic razor.” The ad, like several in the new campaign, concludes with the tagline, “Welcome to the brotherhood of shaving.”

headline.main: A Lucky Few, This Band of Brothers, and the Less Blood Shed the Better
